entity

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • entity.Entity
      • entity.Player
        • entity.Enemy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdvancedEnemy

    public class Enemy
extends Player
    This class represents all enemies in the game. This class extends a player class but has automated movement and attacking.
    Author:
    Trevor Aquino

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class entity.Entity

        DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, UP

      creates a new Enemy and initializes its width, height, and direction depending on parameters given

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(TileMap tm,
     LevelState gs,
     int i,
     boolean direction)
        creates a new Enemy and initializes its width, height, and direction depending on parameters given
        Parameters:
        tm - current TileMap
        gs - current GameState
        i - the block number associated with this enemy
        direction - true if moving horizontal

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double x)
        Parameters:
        x - new speed

      • update

        public void update()
        updates the enemy by going through certain steps 1. check if the enemy is still alive 2. check if the enemy is attacking 3. check if the enemy intersects with a player, if so attack 4. move the enemy to the next space depending on its direction 5. check if enemy is dead and if so, remove from game
        Overrides:
        update in class Player

      • move

        public void move()
        depending on whether or not the enemy moves horizontal, change the direction of movement whenever the enemy is not within the middle half of the TileMap

      • hit

        public void hit()
        subtract health by one
        Overrides:
        hit in class Player

      • attack

        public void attack()
        attack in all four directions and check if attacks intersect any players, if so damage the player
        Overrides:
        attack in class Player

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        draw the enemy in its current position and its attacks if attacking
        Overrides:
        draw in class Player
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object

        public int getBlockNum()
        Returns:
